intro: Urachne macrathera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf urachne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a distinct, sometimes aromatic scent. Urachne macrathera is typically found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
